question: Average items in the Product Backlog are usually…
explanation:
Items of different sizes are added to the Product Backlog
5. Items are sorted based on their business value
6. Large items on the top of the Product Backlog are broken down into smaller ones
That’s why the items on the top are smaller than those on the bottom. Also, because
items selected for the Sprint Backlog come from the top of the Product Backlog, they are
expected to be smaller than the average item in the Product Backlog.
Remember that size is not a basis for ordering the Product Backlog items; it just happens
automatically because of our process.
2.

answers.title: The same size as the items in the Sprint Backlog
Smaller than items in the Sprint Backlog
Larger than items in the Sprint Backlog

question: Which three of the following are true about Scrum?
explanation:
Scrum is a framework, not a methodology or body of knowledge.
Scrum is empirical, rather than theoretical.
Scrum is more about project delivery rather than project management.
Scrum is adaptive, rather than predictive (it’s more than just using Sprints and related
artifacts).
Scrum should be used entirely (we do not tailor it).

answers.title: Scrum is a development framework
Scrum is based on empirical process control theory
Scrum is predictive
Scrum should be tailored to suit the project environment
Scrum is adaptive

question:
A scaled Scrum environment is one that conforms to Scrum framework and uses more
than one Scrum Team for one or more Sprints.
explanation:
Scaled Scrum is the use of more than one team. It can be for only a few Sprints though,
and they should always follow the framework.

answers.title: False
True

question: What does a trend line through a release burn-down chart indicate?
explanation:
The horizontal axis is time, the vertical axis is the remaining amount of work, and the
trend line shows the forecast finish date if the Product Backlog and the team capacity
stay the same.

answers.title: When the remaining work is supposed to be finished

When the remaining work will likely be completed if nothing changes in the Product
Backlog or the Development Team
The budgeted cost of the project

When the project will likely finish, if the team develops with a speed equal to the last
Sprint

question: Which of the following is most essential to Scrum?
explanation:
Scrum is an Agile framework, and Agility is mainly about adaptation (instead of
prediction).

answers.title: Collaboration
Adaptation
Customer satisfaction
Being fast

question:
Which of the following should be considered for setting the duration of Sprints? (Choose
multiple answers
explanation:
When Sprints are shorter, there are more opportunities for demonstration, receiving
feedback, and adaptation. So, when risks are higher, it’s better to have shorter Sprints (if
it is possible). Besides that, we should collaborate with the business, so the duration of
Sprints should be compatible with their business events. And finally, Sprints should not
be longer than one calendar month.
7.

answers.title: It shouldn’t be more than one calendar month

It shouldn’t be so long that other business events can’t be synchronized with the
development work
It shouldn’t be so long that the risk is unacceptable to the Product Owner

question: A senior manager frequently distracts the team. Who should try to solve this problem?
explanation: The Scrum Master is responsible for removing impediments.

answers.title: The whole Scrum Team
The Scrum Master
The Developer
The Product Owner

question: Who should know the most about the progress toward a business objective or a release?
explanation:
Measuring the release or project performance is the Product Owner’s responsibility.
Measuring the Sprint performance is the Development Team’s responsibility.

answers.title: The Project Manager
The Scrum Master
The Scrum Team
The Developer
The Product Owner

question: Which three activities will a Product Owner likely engage in during a Sprint?
explanation:
The Product Owner keeps communicating with the stakeholders, creates new items in
the Product Backlog, revises the order of items, answer questions and makes sure
everyone has the right understanding of items, and checks the completed items with the
Development Team to ensure they are complete based on the Definition of Done.
Creating and prioritizing the tasks, running Daily Scrums, and measuring the Sprint
performance are the Development Team’s responsibility.

answers.title: Answer developers questions about the Sprint Backlog items
Remove impediments
Create new items in the Product Backlog
Participate in Daily Scrums
Reorder the Product Backlog items
Update the Sprint burn-down chart

question: Which statement best describes the Sprint Backlog?
explanation:
The Sprint Backlog is created during the Sprint Planning, which is the first event in the
Sprint.
It includes both items selected from the Product Backlog (by the Development Team),
and the tasks created by decomposing the items (by the Development Team) in a Sprint
Backlog. The Development Team keeps adding tasks during the Sprint, so, the Sprint
Backlog updates. It’s the Development Team’s plan for the current Sprint. This plan is
not detailed upfront.
If the Development Team cannot deliver some of the items, they will go back to the
Product Backlog at the end of the Sprint, and they will be ordered again; they do not go
to the next Sprint automatically.
Each task is assigned to one developer or a pair of developers, but the ownership is still
shared. Items are not assigned or owned by specific developers, all of them share
accountability.

answers.title: It contains all the remaining items from the previous Sprint
Each of its items has a designated owner
It is never updated during the Sprint
It is created in the beginning of the Sprint

question: Which three of the following actions should a Scrum Master do in starting up a project?
explanation:
We do only self-organized activities in the beginning that do not end up with some kind of
upfront plan.

answers.title:
Ask the Developer members to introduce themselves to each other and tell
about their skills and background
Ensure that team members have clear roles and responsibilities
Ensure that a bonus system is in place for top performance of individuals

Ask the Developer to discuss and identify the way they are going to
develop the product

Ask the Product Owner to explain the project, its business need, history, goals, and
context
Ask the development managers to introduce their departments and capabilities
Ensure that there’s a clear understanding of the complete scope of the project

question: Every Scrum project should have a Scrum Master and a Product Owner.
explanation:
Every Scrum project needs a Scrum Master and a Product Owner, even if the team is
mature. Both roles can be part-time.

answers.title: True; part-time or full-time.
True; they should be dedicated to one project at a time.
False

question: How often should Developers membership change?
explanation:
We don’t expect it to change often, but if required, it shouldn’t be during the Sprint, and
we should keep in mind that it creates a short time reduction in the productivity, because
everyone has to help new team members get to know the project.
Another important point is that increasing the number of developers does not always
increase productivity.

answers.title: As needed, with caution
Every Sprint, to keep the composition dynamic
Never
Like in any other project

question: The Developers has realized that they have over committed themselves for the Sprint. What should they do?
explanation:
When we realize that we have over committed ourselves and we are not able to deliver
many of the Spring Backlog items, we still keep working and deliver whatever we can.
However, it might be possible to simplify some of them and deliver more (it’s sometimes
a good idea, sometimes a bad one). The Development Team and the Product Owner can
consider this possibility, and adjust the Sprint Backlog accordingly. This adjustment is
usually about the “tasks” in the Sprint Backlog (which are referred to as “work” or “plan”
in the exam).
Reminder: there are two elements in the Sprint Backlog, the items selected from the
Product Backlog, and the tasks that are created gradually during the Sprint.
Many believe that it’s not right to change the Sprint Backlog “items” during the Sprint
(e.g. Jeff Sutherland, and old writings of Ken Schwaber), while the Scrum Guide doesn’t
make it clear about the “items”, and there’s usually no question about them in the exam.
All questions that I know of are about the “work” defined in the Sprint Backlog, or the
“plan”, which both refer to the tasks in the Sprint Backlog.

answers.title: Nothing
Move some items back to the Product Backlog

Call the Product Owner to review the items with them and revise the Sprint Backlog
if necessary
Ask the Scrum Master to solve the problem

question: Which of the following can be delivered as the output of a Sprint?
explanation:
The output of the Sprints is the Increment: the piece of working software which is
potentially shippable and “done”, based on the Definition of Done (including all the tests).
All items we deliver are non-technical and independent of each other.

answers.title: A UML diagram
The requirement specification document
A few new features that the customer can easily try and experiment
An Increment of software with minor known bugs in it

question: The Product Owner should prepare the Sprint Goal before the Sprint Planning.
explanation: The Sprint Goal is composed by the whole Scrum Team during the Sprint Planning

answers.title: True
False

question: Who’s responsible for engaging the stakeholders?
explanation:
The Product Owner is responsible for engaging them, understanding them,
communicating with them and so on.

answers.title: The Developer
The Scrum Team
The Scrum Master
The Product Owner

question: The purpose of ALL Sprints is to produce a done Increment of working product
explanation:
The purpose of all Sprints is to create an Increment, which is “done”, a piece of working
software usable for the users, “potentially releasable”, and “potentially shippable”.
However, we do not necessarily “release” or “ship” all Increments.
Remember that Scrum.org doesn’t accept any special type of Sprint, such as Sprint 0,
Hardening Sprint, Release Sprint, Integration Sprint, etc. All Sprints are the same.

answers.title: True
False

question: Who determines the number of Product Backlog items selected for a Sprint?
explanation:
It’s completely up to the Development Team to decide on the number of items they are
pulling for a Sprint

answers.title: The Scrum Master
The Scrum Team
The Product Owner and the Developers together
The Product Owner
The Developers

question: Which of the following is the most important concern in scaled Scrum?
explanation:
Even though Product Backlog items are independent of each other, multiple teams
working on the same product might still have dependencies (e.g. because of working on
the same piece of work) and it should be addressed properly.

answers.title: Making sure there’s enough work for all teams
Coordinating the activities of teams
Minimizing dependencies among teams
Assigning items to teams
Having a clear Definition of Done that works for all teams

question: The Developers cannot forecast how much work they can do in the upcoming Sprint, because of the uncertainties in the Product Backlog which the Product Owner is not able to overcome. What two actions should the Scrum Master recommend?
explanation:
The number of Product Backlog items picked in the Sprint Planning is the plan for the
Sprint, but nothing happens if the team cannot deliver all of them; it’s just a guess. If
stakeholders start to blame the team for not delivering everything, the team will pick
fewer items in the next Sprint and in turn end up with less productivity.
It is however a problem that the items are not clear and it will certainly create more
issues through the Sprint. Therefore, it’s a very important topic for the next Sprint
Retrospective, when everyone should try to fix it.
The Sprint Planning is timeboxed; never extended. It’s also not possible to cancel the
meeting and hold it another time (it’s almost like extending the duration).
It’s nonsense to cancel the Sprint when it’s not practically started. On the other hand,
only the Product Owner can cancel the Sprint (when the goal becomes obsolete).

answers.title: Cancel the Sprint and start the next one when the items are clear

Ask the developers to come up with their best guess and do not worry about the
capacity

Cancel the Sprint Planning meeting, give them some time to prepare, and then hold
another Sprint Planning

Extend the duration of Sprint Planning and ask them to discuss the items more and
get into agreement

Invite everyone to discuss this problem in the next Sprint Retrospective and try to
find a solution

question: What’s the responsibility of the Product Owner during Sprint zero?
explanation:
There’s no such thing as Sprint zero. The first Sprint is called Sprint 1, and it’s exactly
the same as other Sprints: creates an Increment. The infrastructure and tools and
requirements are prepared gradually throughout the project.

answers.title: Prepare the requirements specification document
Prepare all Product Backlog items to be used during the project
Prepare enough items in the Product Backlog for the first few Sprints
There’s no such thing as Sprint zero

question: When should a new potentially releasable piece of software be available?
explanation:
An Increment of “done” working software, which is potentially releasable, must be
produced at the end of each Sprint.

answers.title: Every few Sprints
Based on the release plan
At the end of each Sprint
When the Product Owner needs it

question: Scrum is a development methodology that provides a practical Agile environment
explanation: Scrum is a framework rather than a methodology, and it’s not detailed.

answers.title: False
True

question: The Developers has realized that they have selected too many items for the Sprint Backlog, while they are in the middle of the Sprint Planning. Which two of the following are proper actions in this case
explanation:
We can freely change the number, because it’s still “during” the Sprint Planning.
If we want to, we can just start the Sprint with the high number of items, because nothing
happens if we do not deliver everything.
We work on a constant pace (no overtime work). We do not like to change the
composition of the team often, because we know that adding more developers does not
always increase productivity, and even if it does, it will not happen in the short term

answers.title: Remove some of the lower priority items
Add more developers to the team
Work overtime and finish everything
Inform the Product Owner and start development

question: The Sprint Goal and the Sprint Backlog are the results of Sprint Planning
explanation:
The Sprint Backlog is created in the Sprint Planning, and updated during the Sprint; both
done by the Development Team.
The Sprint Goal is composed by the whole Scrum Team in the Sprint Planning meeting

answers.title: True
False

question: Which of the following are outputs of Sprint Planning? (Choose multiple answers)
explanation:
The Sprint Backlog and Sprint Goal are the main outputs of Sprint Planning. The Sprint
Backlog itself consists of the items selected from the Product Backlog, and tasks created
by decomposing the items

answers.title: Resource assignments
Product Backlog estimates
Sprint Goal
Items selected from the Product Backlog
Tasks
Product Backlog order

question: When the Scrum Team becomes mature enough, the following decision might be taken
explanation:
The Definition of Done includes quality methods and that’s why we keep improving it
when we mature.
All Scrum roles, events, and artifacts are necessary and should not be ignored for any
reason.

answers.title: They won’t need a Scrum Master any more
They won’t need timeboxed events any more
They will add more stringent criteria to the Definition of Done
They will need longer Sprint Retrospectives

question: Which of the following best describes Scrum?
explanation:
Scrum is adaptive instead of predictive. It’s a framework rather than a methodology or
body of knowledge. It’s mainly about project delivery rather than project management.
It’s empirical (based on experience) rather than theoretical. It’s suitable for the
development of complex products in complex environments.

answers.title: An adaptive project development framework
A complete project development methodology
A project development body of knowledge
A predictive project development framework

question: What is the best way a Scrum Master optimizes the team productivity?
explanation:
Facilitation (as requested or needed), removing impediments and solving problems,
training, coaching, consulting, and convincing people to do the right thing are the things
we expect from the Scrum Master. S/he is not supposed to block the team’s selforganization
by giving developers orders, or deciding for them, and s/he is not supposed
to do other people’s jobs (e.g. ordering the items instead of letting the Product Owner do
so).

answers.title: Measuring performance and communicating it to the stakeholders
Communicating with the customer and understanding their requirements
Making the Product Backlog items clear and understood
Facilitation and problem solving

question: Which two of the following are NOT Developers responsibilities?
explanation:
It’s the Development Team’s responsibility to measure their productivity and performance
during the Sprint, find their way, plan, and optimize the work required for items and the
Sprint Goal, and resolve their own conflicts. Remember that they are self-organized

answers.title: Monitoring productivity
Resolving their conflicts
Reporting the Sprint progress to the customer
Prioritizing the new Product Backlog items

question:
Adding more resources to a Scrum project increases productivity and the delivery of
value proportionally.
explanation:
Normally, if you double the resources (team members), your productivity will increase
less than twice; in other words, it’s not proportional.
There’s also the Brook’s Law that claims “adding manpower to a late software project
makes it later” (you don’t need it for the exam).

answers.title: False
True

question:
What are the benefits of testing Sprint Backlog items during the Sprint? (Choose three
answers)
explanation:
Items are not really done, unless we have tested them; so, tests should be included in
the Definition of Done. In this case, the Increments will be closer to what we can
practically call “complete”, “done”, “potentially releasable”, or “potentially shippable”; to
something usable for the users.
Increments should be potentially releasable; for starters, because it makes it easier for
the customer to try it and give us back useful feedback. The feedback enables
adaptation, which is essential to Agile.
Having an effective Definition of Done increases transparency, because everyone will
know what we mean when we say an item is done.
34.

answers.title: Improves the quality of the feedbacks received in the Sprint Review
Increments become potentially releasable
Increment becomes more transparent
Reduces dependencies among Product Backlog items

question:
Which two of the following are acceptable ways of handling infrastructure and
architecture?
explanation:
The preferred way is to do them gradually, as a part of other Product Backlog items. If
they are very basic, we can also add them to the Product Backlog directly. In that case,
we still cannot limit a Sprint to only the architecture and infrastructure items and at least
a few business functionalities should be delivered too.

answers.title: They will be done by a separate team
They will be done before the first Sprint, so that everything is ready
They will be done step by step, in the slack between Sprints
They will be done as a part of other Product Backlog items

They will be added to the Product Backlog to be done in the early Sprints, while at
least a few business functionalities are also delivered during those Sprints

question: During a Sprint, when is new work added to the Sprint Backlog?
explanation:
There are two elements in the Sprint Backlog:
4. The items selected from the Product Backlog: we don’t change them after the Sprint
Planning
5. The tasks created by breaking down the items: only a few of them are created in the
Sprint Planning, and the rest will be created during the Sprint (any day). Otherwise, it
would be a form of upfront planning. Remember that “tasks” are referred to as “work” or
“plan” in the PSM exam.
The Sprint Backlog is owned by the Development Team, and no one else is allowed to
create or update it.

answers.title: When the Scrum Master is ready to do so
As soon as they are identified
When the Product Owner is ready to do so
During the Daily Scrums

question: Which best describes the cross-functionality?
explanation:
Everything needed to create a potentially releasable piece of software, usable for the end
user, should be done in the cross-functional team. So, they need to have all the
expertise.
Each developer has one or more types of expertise, such as architecture, programming,
testing, and UI design. The sum of all members creates a cross-functional team and the
individuals do not need to be cross-functional.

answers.title:
Members of the Developers should have all the expertise needed for the
production of the Product Backlog items

The Developers members should collaborate not only with the customer,
but also with all functional units in the performing organization as well as the business

The Developers should have all the expertise required for the product, in a
way that they do not need any help from the outside

question:
When the Sprints are two weeks and there are six developers in the team, what would be
the timebox for the Sprint Planning meeting
explanation:
The Sprint Planning is timeboxed for 8 hours when the Sprint is one month long, and
shorter proportionally.

answers.title: 4 hours
3 hours
6 hours
Monthly
8 hours

question: Which two of the following are feedback loops in Scrum?
explanation:
All four events inside the Sprint are feedback loops and opportunities for inspection and
adaptation: Sprint Planning, Daily Scrums, Sprint Review, and Sprint Retrospective

answers.title: Daily Scrum
Sprint Review
Sprint
Product Backlog refinement

question:
The team doesn’t have the tools and infrastructure required for the development of items.
What should the Scrum Master do?
explanation:
We do not prepare the infrastructure and tools upfront, because it requires an
understanding of the whole product, which is against the adaptation concept. The
required infrastructure and tools depend on the product we’re going to create, which in
turn is defined throughout the project. So, the infrastructure and tools will be prepared
gradually throughout the project.
There’s no Sprint zero in Scrum. All Sprints are the same, used to create an Increment of
working software.
40.

answers.title: Allow them to spend some time preparing before starting the first Sprint
Start Sprint zero for preparation and then start developing with Sprint one

Have them improve the tools and infrastructure over time and adjust the Definition of
Done accordingly

question: How many hours per day should a developer work?
explanation:
Working at a sustainable pace is one of the Agile principles. This helps increase
productivity and quality.

answers.title: Not more than 16 hours prior to the releases, as long as they take a break after that.
Depending on the organizational policies
At a sustainable pace (usually 6 to 8 hours)
As much as needed for completing the planned items

question: When should the Product Owner ship an Increment?
explanation:
All Increments should be potentially releasable (shippable), but we don’t have to release
all of them. It depends on the project environment and the customer, and the Product
Owner is supposed to make decision.

answers.title: When the Developers is ready for shipment
As needed
Every Sprint
When the Increment is releasable

question: Which three of the following are true about Product Owners?
explanation:
The Product Owner creates and orders the Product Backlog items and makes sure that
everyone understands them. Estimating the items and breaking them down into tasks are
done by the Development Team.
There can be a committee for the product ownership, but only their representative will be
called Product Owner. So, there’s only one Product Owner. This person can be full-time
or part-time. One person can have more than one role in Scrum (e.g. both the Product
Owner and the Scrum Master). While it’s not forbidden, it’s not recommended.

answers.title: Is responsible for removing impediments
Can also be the Scrum Master
Is accountable for ordering the Product Backlog
Is one person
Creates tasks for the Product Backlog items

question: Who should create the Sprint Goal?
explanation: The Sprint Goal is created at the Sprint Planning meeting by the whole Scrum Team.

answers.title: The Scrum Master
The Product Owner
The Scrum Team
The Product Owner and the Developers together
The Developers

question: Which does a self-managing Developers choose?
explanation:
The Product Backlog order and composition, project performance measurement, and
release planning are the Product Owner’s responsibilities. The Sprint length is
determined by the whole Scrum Team.

answers.title: The priority of Product Backlog items
How to compose the Product Backlog items
How many items to pick for the Sprint backlog
How to measure project performance

question: Which two statements are correct about testers?
explanation:
There are only three roles in Scrum: Product Owner, Scrum Master, and Development
Team. It’s not allowed to define new roles and the Development Team members should
not have any titles; they are all just “developers”. It is so, because we want all of them to
be accountable for everything and to collaborate with each other.
Each person has his/her own area of expertise, such as testing, and that person will be
more focused on testing tasks, but it doesn’t mean we can call the person “tester”.

answers.title: There’s no such role in Scrum
They find bugs
They collaborate with architects and business analysts
They verify the work of programmers
Everyone in the Developers are responsible for quality

question: When do Developers members volunteer to own a Sprint Backlog item?
explanation:
The Developers share the ownership of the items and tasks in the Sprint Backlog.
Tasks are assigned to the Developers (by themselves), but they all stay accountable
(own the task).
Items are not assigned to Developers, as each item consists of multiple tasks that need
varying expertise.To summarize:
5. Items are not owned by individuals/pairs
6. Items are not assigned to individuals/pairs
7. Tasks are not owned by individuals/pairs
8. Tasks are indeed assigned to individuals/pairs
It’s a good practice to use Pair Programming in Agile, which is when two developers
work on the same piece of code. One developer writes code and the other observes and
comments. After a while, they switch places. Note that you won’t have questions about
pair programming in the PSM I exam.
Note: “tasks” are usually referred to as “work” or “plan” in the PSM I exam.

answers.title: Whenever the team member has free capacity for more work
During the Daily Scrums
They don’t do so
In the Sprint Planning meeting
After the Daily Scrums

question: When is a Sprint canceled?
explanation:
Only the Product Owner has the authority to cancel a Sprint. It is done when the Sprint
doesn’t make sense any more or the Sprint Goal has become obsolete

answers.title: When a senior manager decides so

When the Developers realizes it’s not able to complete more than half of the
Sprint Backlog items
When the Scrum Team feels that the work is too hard
When the Sprint Goal becomes obsolete

question: The product must be released to production at the end of each Sprint.
explanation:
All Increments must be complete based on the Definition of Done, and be potentially
releasable/shippable. However, we don’t have to actually release all of them. It’s up to
the Product Owner to decide on the releases based on the project environment

answers.title: False
True

question: Who has the final say on the Product Backlog items?
explanation:
The decision on the order of items can be influenced by a committee, the customer, or
any other stakeholders, but the final say belongs to the Product Owner. This decision
should be respected by the whole organization.
Remember that estimating the amount of work for items is the responsibility of the
Development Team.

answers.title: The Product Owner
The Developers
The customer
The whole Scrum Team

question: When may a Developer change its engineering practices?
explanation:
The engineering practices and all other technical aspects are completely up to the
Development Team and they can change them whenever they find it necessary

answers.title: In the Sprint Retrospective
Before the end of Sprint Planning
Whenever needed
Before starting a new Sprint

question: Who’s in the Scrum Team? (Choose multiple answers)
explanation:
Yes, some exam questions are as easy as this one. But be careful, a question might
seem easy just because you didn’t read it carefully.

answers.title: Scrum Master
Developers
Team leader(s)
Product Owner
Project manager

question:
Which of the following topics should be discussed in the Sprint Review? (Multiple
answers
explanation:
There are two main things we should do in the Sprint Review meeting: the Development
Team demonstrates the Increment to the customer and the Product Owner presents the
performance information (especially the forecast of the completion date) to the customer

answers.title: Sprint results
Progress
Scrum process and improvements for the next Sprint
Lessons learned

question: What are two common benefits of self-managing ?
explanation:
Being self-organized means that the team finds its own way, instead of receiving orders.
When it is so, there is more buy-in (commitment), accountability, and creativity among
team members.

answers.title: Increased predictability
Increased cross-functionality
Increased buy-in
Increased creativity
Increased respect

question: The Sprint Review is:
explanation:
All four events inside the Sprint are opportunities for inspection and adaptation.
During the Sprint Review, the Development Team demonstrates the Increment and the
Product Owner presents the performance information

answers.title: When the customer inspects the Increment and progress, and provides feedback
When we review the Scrum Team’s activities and processes in use
When we review the way we can improve in the next Sprint
When we review the feasibility of the project

question: Which two of the following are true about the Scrum Master role?
explanation:
The Scrum Master does not manage people, and does not have to be full-time.
The Development Team is self-organized and handles the assignments itself, and
measures the performance of the Sprints.
It is the Product Owner’s responsibility to identify what has been done before the Sprint
Review, since s/he is the main contact person with the stakeholders.

answers.title: Works with other Scrum Masters in the organization to adopt Scrum
Should be dedicated to one project at a time
Is the contact point between the team and the customer
Teaches the Developers to keep the meetings to their timebox
Manages the Developers for maximizing the productivity

question: When is the time for Sprint Retrospectives?
explanation:
All events are necessary and are held every Sprint; including the Sprint Retrospective,
which is the last event inside each Sprint.

answers.title: Whenever needed, based on lessons learned
At the end of the first few Sprints
In the beginning of each Sprint
In the beginning of the first few Sprints
At the end of each Sprint

question: Who’s the project manager in Scrum?
explanation:
Scrum doesn’t have a project manager role. The project management activities are
distributed among the three Scrum roles

answers.title: The Product Owner
No one
The Scrum Master
The Developer leader

question: Which three of the following are responsibilities of a self-managing team?
explanation:
It’s the responsibility of the Development Team to estimate the amount of work of
Product Backlog items, and select an appropriate number of them for each Sprint. They
also break down the items into tasks during the Sprint.
Measuring the project performance is the responsibility of the Product Owner, while
measuring the Sprint performance is done by the Development Team.
Creating new Product Backlog items, ordering them (prioritization), and making sure
everyone has a clear understanding of them is the responsibility of the Product Owner.

answers.title: Make the Sprint Backlog items clear by communications with the customer
Prioritize Product Backlog items
Track the performance of the project
Develop the Sprint Backlog items
Measure and visualize their own performance throughout the Sprint
Select items from the Product Backlog to be developed during the Sprint

question: Who estimates the work of the newly identified items?
explanation:
All estimates are done by the Development Team, since they are the ones who know
how to do the worK

answers.title: The Developers
The Product Owner
The Developers and the Product Owner together
The Scrum Master
The whole Scrum Team

question:
Who must do all the work required for the Product Backlog items, based on the Definition
of Done?
explanation:
The Development Team is cross-functional and can do the A to Z of each Product
Backlog item. They don’t need any external help.
The work of the Product Owner and the Scrum Master are also different and they do not
do anything directly on the items.

answers.title: The Developers
The Scrum Master
The Scrum Team
The Product Owner

question: The Product Owner makes sure the Developers selects enough items from the Project Backlog for a Sprint to satisfy the customer
explanation:
It is totally up to the Development Team to decide how many items they are going to
select for the Sprint

answers.title: False
True

question:
It’s recommended to have analysts employ a “definition of ready” to ensure all items at
the top of the Product Backlog are actionable once they are selected for the Sprint
Backlog.
explanation:
We like the items on the top of the Product Backlog to be “ready” for development, and
we do our best in “Product Backlog refinement” for that. However, we just continue
normally even if the items are not ready, and try to make them clear during the Sprint.
This is why there’s no “definition of ready” in Scrum, as defined by the Scrum Guide.
We don’t wait to have ready items before starting them, because this can be an excuse
for having a basis other than business value. On the other hand, having too many
unready items on the top of the backlog is usually a symptom of a problem; you should
find the root cause and fix that, instead of accepting it as a fact by creating a “definition of ready”.
Also, remember that only the items on the top of the Product Backlog need to be ready

answers.title: False
True

question: What should be done between two Sprints?
explanation:
There’s no time between one Sprint and the next.
Ordering the Product Backlog items and estimating the amount of work of new items
needed for the next Sprint Planning is done during the previous one, in a continuous
process called Product Backlog refinement (or Product Backlog grooming).

answers.title: Nothing; there’s no time between the two
Add new items to the Product Backlog, estimate, and order them
Work to ensure that the customer understands the developed items
Receive feedback from the customer

question: What’s the role of a PMO in an organization that only uses Scrum for project delivery?
explanation:
There are many different forms of PMOs and it’s hard to define it. No matter what it does,
it shouldn’t block the self-organization of Scrum teams. On the other hand, Scrum is only
about projects and there should be another system for managing programs and
portfolios. The latter can be facilitated by a PMO.

answers.title:
Managing portfolios and programs and facilitating the application of techniques that
complement Scrum
The PMO should manage and help the Product Owners
The PMO will be responsible for making higher level decisions in the project
There’s no place for a PMO in such an organization
The PMO should manage and help the Scrum Masters

question: When is a Sprint over?
explanation:
Sprints are timeboxed and they are not extendable. Some timeboxes have a maximum
duration and will be finished earlier if everything is done, but Sprint timeboxes have a
fixed duration, which does not shrink either. If everything is finished before the end of the
Sprint, the Development Team will pick the next item from the Product Backlog and
starts working on that

answers.title: When all items are done
When the predefined timebox duration is over
When the Product Owner approves it
When the timebox is over or everything is done

question:
The Scrum Master could not resolve some of the issues. Which two of the following are
good techniques to overcome this problem?
explanation:
It’s always a good idea to ask the rest of the team for help (consultation), but we prefer
not to get help from outside the team, because it will weaken our self-organization.

answers.title: Ask the senior management for help
Ask the Developers for help
Cancel the Sprint and focus on solving the problem
Ask the Product Owner for help
Ask the project manager for help

question: How is a Product Backlog ordered?
explanation:
The Product Backlog is ordered based on the value of items to the business, and it is up
to the Product Owner to determine how to calculate the value.
Size, criticality, and risk all affect the “value”, but are not directly the basis for ordering.
Items should be independent of each other, so that we can freely order them based on
the value.

answers.title:
Based on the customer’s feedback received for the requirement specification
document
It doesn’t have a specific order
Based on the Product Owner’s judgment
Riskier items should be on top

question: What’s the purpose of Scrum of Scrums
explanation:
In scaled Scrum, where multiple teams work on the same project/product, there is a
normal Daily Scrum for each team to align and synchronize. Then one representative
from each team goes to the Scrum of Scrum meeting, which is similar to Daily Scrum, to
align and synchronize teams instead of team members.
Note: the newly released scaled framework from Scrum.org, called Nexus Framework,
doesn’t have a Scrum of Scrums and uses Nexus Daily Scrum instead.

answers.title: To align multiple teams that are working on the same product
To let Scrum Masters share experience and lessons learned
A meeting to report to stakeholders
To align teams working on multiple Scrum projects
To let Scrum teams share experience and lessons learned

question: Which two of the following are Scrum Master responsibilities during the Sprint ?
explanation:
The Scrum Master ensures that Scrum is understood and enacted entirely, removes
impediments (solves problems), and facilitates the meetings as requested or needed.

answers.title: Approve completed deliverables
Remove impediments
Ensure the Product Owner spends enough time for the project
Communicate the progress with stakeholders
Measure the progress

question: Who decides on the technical approach
explanation:
It is completely up to the self-organized Development Team to decide on the way they
work and on the technical aspects of the project.

answers.title: Architects
The Product Owner
The Scrum Master
The whole Scrum Team
The Developers

question:
A developer does not work properly and is blocking the team activity. Who should decide
on removing that person?
explanation:
This is the responsibility of the Development Team, because it is self-organized. Since it
is some kind of impediment, they may also get help from the Scrum Master.

answers.title: The Product Owner
The hiring manager
The whole Scrum Team
The Developers, probably with the help of the Scrum Master

question: When is a Product Backlog item considered complete
explanation:
When the item is complete based on the Definition of Done, which means that the end
users can use it, and it creates an Increment of working software that is potentially
releasable.
Note: if all the tasks for an item are complete, it doesn’t necessarily mean that the item is
complete, because we might have forgotten to add some of the tasks

answers.title: When the whole Developers agrees that it is done
When there’s nothing more we can do before it can be used by the end users
When the customer approves its completeness
When the Scrum Master approves it

question: Which of the following best describes the Product Backlog
explanation:
The Product Backlog is a type of planning. However, we don’t create predictive, detailed
upfront plans in Agile environments; so, the Product Backlog is dynamic and never
complete. It only provides enough information for a self-organized team to find its own
way. It’s always changing to enable adaptation.

answers.title: It is the basis for the team to create a complete project plan
It is the predictive plan for the final product of the project
It provides just enough information to enable the team develop the product
It is the result of the requirement specification phase of the project

question: Which three statements describe the usage of the Definition of Done?
explanation:
The Definition of Done explains everything we should do for all Product Backlog items.
So, everyone will have the same understanding when the Development Team says
something is done (transparency). It also helps the team better understand what is
expected from them for each item, and therefore it is easier for them to plan the Sprint.
The work that should be done until the end of the Sprint to have all items developed
depends both on the Definition of Done, and the definition of items that have been
selected from the Product Backlog.
The purpose/objective of each Sprint is described in its Sprint Goal

answers.title: Describe the objective of each Sprint
Describes the work that should be done until the end of the Sprint
Creates a common understanding of when work is complete

Helps developers understand how many Product Backlog items they can select for
each Sprint
Increases transparency

question: What happens if the Developers cannot complete all Sprint Backlog items by the end of the Sprint?
explanation:
Nothing happens! The Development Team will deliver only the items that are 100% done
based on the Definition of Done.
The only thing the Development Team may do, is inform the Product Owner, so that s/he
can revise the order of items if necessary, and work with her/him to review and adjust the
work (“work” here refers to the “tasks”, not the “items”).

answers.title: The Sprint time will be extended permanently
The remaining items will be moved to the next Sprint
The Sprint will be over with the completed items
The Sprint time will be extended temporarily

question:
When multiple teams are working on the same project, there should be one Definition of
Done for all of them
explanation:
The teams might be working on different parts of the product (e.g. desktop application,
mobile application, web application), or simply have different styles of work, and
therefore require different Definitions of Done. This is all right, as long as their definitions
are compatible and have the capacity to create integrated, potentially releasable
Increments. The definitions should also contain all the minimum requirements coming
from the organization.
Note: When multiple teams are working on the same project, all their outputs will be
combined into one integrated Increment. They also have only one Product Backlog, and
one Product owner.

answers.title: True
False

question: The CEO wants the Developers to add a very important item to the current Sprint. What should they do?
explanation:
Only the Product Owner can add new items to the Product Backlog. Even s/he cannot
add a new item to the Sprint Backlog during the Sprint.
When someone asks for a change in the Sprint Backlog, they should be referred to the
Product Owner, so that s/he can work with them to define the item and add it to the
Product Backlog for the next Sprints.
In fact, we reject the request for adding the item to the current Sprint Backlog, but this
rejection should be done by the Product Owner, rather than the Development Team

answers.title: Add the item to the Product Backlog
Add the item to the current Sprint Backlog
Replace an item in the current Sprint Backlog with the new one
Reject the request
Inform the Product Owner so that s/he can work with the CEO

question: When is the Sprint Backlog created?
explanation:
The Sprint Backlog is created in the Sprint Planning meeting, and updated during the
Sprint.
There are two elements in the Sprint Backlog:
5. The items selected from the Product Backlog: we don’t change them after the Sprint
Planning
6. The tasks created by breaking down the items: only a few of them are created in the
Sprint Planning, and the rest will be created during the Sprint. Otherwise, it would be a
form of upfront planning. Remember that “tasks” are referred to as “work” or “plan” in the
PSM I exam.
The Sprint Backlog is owned by the Development Team, and no one else is allowed to
create or update it.
79.

answers.title: During the Sprint Planning
All the way through the project
Right before the Sprint Planning
At the beginning of the project
After the Sprint Planning

question: Which of the following is not done in the first Sprint? (Choose 2 answers)
explanation:
There’s no difference between the first Sprint and the rest of them; we create an
Increment of working software, get feedback from the customer (Sprint Review), and
plan for improvements in the next Sprint (Sprint Retrospective

answers.title: Create the first Increment
Demonstrate a piece of working software to the customer
Complete the solution architecture for the whole product
Plan the first few Sprints

question:
The Product Owner has problems managing the Product Backlog. Which of the following
is a proper action by the Scrum Master
explanation:
The Scrum Master is supposed to know the tools and techniques, and to help everyone
in that regard. However, it’s only about helping, training, coaching, and consulting, rather
than taking over.

answers.title:
Take some time off between the two Sprints and have everyone help the Product
Owner until the Product Backlog is ready
Ask the Developers to order the Product Backlog for the Product Owner
Order the Product Backlog for the Product Owner
Suggest common Product Backlog management techniques to the Product Owner

question: When the product owner must be present at the Daily Scrum.

answers.title: When the product owner is actively working on items from the sprint Backlog
when there are  impediments to discuss
when they need to represent the stakeholders point of view
when the scrum master asks them to attend

question: Products Owner wants  advice from the scrum master about estimating work in scrum. What the guidance should a Scrum Master give ?

answers.title: Product Backlog items must be estimated in story points.
Scrum forbids estimating
Estimates must be in  relative units
Estimate are made by the people doing the work
Estimates are made by the product Owner , but are best checked with the developers

question: Why do the Developers need a Sprint Goal ?

answers.title: The Developers are more focused with a common yet specific goal
A sprint Goal only gives purpose to Sprint 0.
A sprint ensures that all of the Product Backlog items selected for the sprint are implemented
Sprint Goals are not valuable . Everything is know from the product Backlog

question: Which of the following are appropriate topics for discussion during a sprint retrospective ( choose the best two answers)

answers.title: Documenting acceptance criteria for items in the next sprint
Identifying high priority process improvements for the next Sprint
How the team collaborates
The order of items in the product backlog

question: Who has the final decision about the order of items in the Product Backlog ?

answers.title: The scrum Team
The Developers
The scrum Master
The product Owner
The stakeholders

question: True or False : When multiple teams work together on the product each teams should maintain a separate Product Backlog

answers.title: True
False

question: What is the scrum Master responsible for during the sprint Retrospective ?

answers.title: Acting as a scribe to capture the scrum Team's answers
Participating as a scrum Team and facilitating requested or needed
Prioritizing the resulting action items
Summarizing and  reporting the discussions to management

question: User documentation is part your definition of Done. However , there are not enough technical writers for all teams. You Scrum Team does not have a technical writer. What should the scrum Team do ?

answers.title: Let the user documentation remain undone and accumulate until after the last development Sprint. It will then be done by any available technical writers.
The Developers  on the scrum Team should write the user documentation
Wait until you have a technical writer on your Scrum Team to take care of this.
Form separate of technical writers that will work on an on-demand basis for the various Product Owners. Work order will be first in, first out.

question: How much of the sprint Backlog must be defined during the Sprint planning event ?

answers.title: Just enough tasks for the scrum Master to be confident the developers understanding of the Sprint
Just enough to understand design and architectural implications
The entire Sprint Backlog must be identified and  estimated by the end of sprint planning
Enough so the developers can create their forecast of what work they can do

question: Which of the following are true about the length of the Sprint

answers.title: Sprint length is determined during Sprint planning and should be long enough to make sure the scrum team can deliver what is to be accomplished in the upcoming Sprint
All Sprints must be one month or less.
The length of the sprint should be proportional to the work that is done in between sprints
Sprint lenght is determined during Sprint Planning and should hold the time it will take to code the planned features in the upcoming sprint but does not include time for any testing

question: What happens it the scrum Team cannot complete its work by the end the sprint ?

answers.title: The sprint is extended temporarity. Lessons are taken to ensure it does not happen again
The sprint lenght is unchanged and the scrum Team continously learns and adapts.
The sprint is  extended and future sprints use this new duration

question: The Scrum Master observes the Product Owner struggling with ordering the Product Backlog. What is an appropriate action for the scrum Master to take

answers.title: Encourage the Product Owner to work with the developers to see which items technically are fastest to implement
Suggest that the developers order the product Backlog to be sure that it is a feasible ordering of work
Offer the product owner help in understanding that the goal of ordering the product Backlog is to maximize value
Suggest the product Owner extend the sprint so he can have more to order product
Present the product Owner with an ordered product Backlog to use.

question: What is the main reason for the Scrum Master to be at the Daily Scrum ?

answers.title: To gather status and progress information to report to management
To make sure every team member answers the three questions
To write down any changes to sprint Backlog , including adding new items , and tracking progress on the burn down
He or she does not have to be there he or she only has to ensure the developers have Daily Scrum

question: Which output from Sprint planning provides the scrum team with a target and overaching direction for the sprint ?

answers.title: The sprint Backlog
Sprint Review minutes
The release plan
The sprint Goal

question: Developers are self-managing , which of the following do they manage ?

answers.title: Stakeholders for the sprint review
Sprint Backlog
Sprint Length
Product Backlog ordering
When to release based on its progress

question: The product Owner is not collaborating with the developers during the Sprint. What are two valuable actions for a scrum Master to take ?

answers.title: Bring up the problem in the sprint retrospective
Nominate a proxy product Owner
Coach the product Owner in the values of scrum and incremental delivery
Stop the sprint , send the product owner to course and restart
Inform the product Owner's functional manager

question: Which answer best describes the topics covered in sprint planning

answers.title: Who is on the team and what team member roles will be
How conditions have cahnged and how the product Backlog should evolve
What went wrong in the last sprint and what to do differntly this sprint.
What can be done , how to do it and why to do it
What to do and who will do it

question: Which statement best describes a product Owner's reponsibility

answers.title: Optimizing the value of the work the Scrum Team does
Ensuring that work meets the commitments to the stakeholders
Keep stakeholders from distacting the developers
Directing the developers

question: Who determines when it is appropriate to update the sprint Backlog during a sprint

The Developers

question: What is the timebox for the Sprint review

answers.title: 2 Hours for a one-month Sprint
As long as needed
1 Day

question: Who is accountable for clearly expressing product backlog items ?

question: Which of the following activities will a product owner engage in during a Sprint ?

Run the Daily Scrum

question: which two things should the scrum Team do during the first sprint ?

answers.title: Define the major product features and a release plan architecture
Create an increment of potentially releasable software
Make Up a plan for the rest of the project

Analyze , describe and document the requirements for the subsequent sprints

question: When the developers determine that they will not be able to finish the complete forecast who has to be present when reviewing and adjusting the Sprint work selected ?

The product owner and all stakeholders

question: Who is on the scrum Team ?

answers.title: Scrum Master

question: Why does the product owner want the developers to adhere to its definition of done ?

To know what the team will deliver over the next three sprints
To know what the team will deliver over the next Sprints

To have complete transparency into what has been done at the end of each sprint

question: A new developer is having continuing conflicts with existing developers on the scrum Team. which is impacting the delivery of the increment. if necessary. who is responsible for removing the developer

answers.title: The Scrum Team is accountable
The hiring manager is responsible.They hired the developer
The Scrum Master is accountable. They remove impediments

question: For which of the following is the scrum Master responsible ?

answers.title: Managing the perfomance of the scrum Team
Keeping track of resource allocation
The meetings and tne objectives that a scrum team sets for itself
Properly adopting and using the scrum framework

question: You are the Scrum Master for four Scrum Teams from the same Product Backlog several of the developers come to you complaining that work identified for the upcoming two Sprints will require full-time commitment from specialist who is external to teams.What should the scrum Master consider in this

answers.title: The desire to maintain a stable velocity
The benefit of developers figuring out a solution for themselves
The ability of the scrum teams to produce integrated increments
The need to have enough work to keep all developers busy

question: Who does all the work to make sure product Backlog items conform to the definition of done

question: which statement best describes the sprint backlog as the output of the sprint planning ?

It is a complete list of all work to be done in a sprint

question: How often should team membership change

As needed , while taking into account a short-team reduction in productivity
Every sprint to promote shared learning
Never , it reduces productivity

question: Who owns the sprint backlog

The scrum master

question: What are the two effective ways for the Scrum Team to make non-functional requirements visible ?

Add Them to the definition of done so work is taken care of every Sprint

Put them on a separate list on the scrum board avaible for all to see

question: In accordance with Scrum Theory how should group of 100 people be divided into multiple Scrum Teams ?

It does not really matter since you can rotate the teams every Sprint to spread Knowledge
Understanding the product , the product vision and the rules of the scrum framework the people divide themselves into teams
Create a matrix of skills , seniority and level of experience to assign people to teams

courage

It provides a template for elements that need to be included in the documentation
It Tracks the percentage complete of a product Backlog item.

question: True or False : Scrum has a role called " Project Manager"

answers.title: True
False

question: Who is responsible for engaging Stakeholders ?

answers.title: The business Analyst
The Developers
The Scrum Team
The project Manager

question: How do you Know that a Scrum Team is cross-functional

answers.title: A few of the Developers pair program and Test Driven Development
There are no conflicts within the Scrum Team
Every member of the scrum Team is able to perform every task
The scrum Team has all the skills to create an increment by the end of every Sprint

question: Who determines how many product Backlog items for a Sprint ?

answers.title: The stakeholders attending Sprint planning
The Scrum Master
The Product Owner
The Scrum Team
The Developers

question: What are two ways that regulatory compliance issues are dealt with in Scrum ?

answers.title: They are addressed along with functional development of the product
They are discussed , determined and documented before the actual feature development Sprints
They are addressed by a separate team who is responsible for compliance issues
They are added to the product Backlog and addressed in early Sprints , while always requiring at least some business functionality. no matter how small.

question: An organization has decided to adopt Scrum but management wants to change the terminology to fit with terminology already used. What will likely happen if this is done ?

answers.title: Management may feel less anxious
All answers apply
Whitout a new vocabulary as a reminder of the change , very little change may actually happen
The organization may not understand what has changed within Scrum and the benefits of scrum may be lost

question: A developer takes the Scrum Master aside to express his concerns about data security issues what should the Scrum Master do ?

answers.title: Create a product Backlog item for security
Go check with the testers
Add security to the definition of Done
Ask the developer to share the concern with the team as soon as possible
Tell the product Owner to stop further development of features until the issues are fixed

question: Which statement best describes the Sprint Review ?

answers.title: It is a demo at the end of the Sprint everyone in the Organization to check on the work done
It is when the scrum Team and stakeholders inspect the Outcome of a Sprint and figure out what to do next ?
It is used to congratulate the developers if they complete their forecast or to punish the developers if they meet their forecast
It is a mechanism to control the developers activities during a Sprint

question: A scrum Team is a cohesive unit professionals that consists of which of the following ?

question: The Scrum Team should have all the skills needed to :

Complete the project within the date and cost as calculated by the product Owner

Its location and time remain constant
It consists of the Scrum Master asking the team for status
It is fifteen minutes or less in duration
It is facilitated by team lead
